title: How to Level Up Your Blacksmithing in Elder Scrolls Online

steps.headline: Locate ore while you are out playing the game.
steps.description: Ore typically looks like a pile of rocks that stick out of the ground when you are walking in the world. You can find them in small corners or in caverns within the game.They come in many different varieties, and each type can be used to make different materials. When you find ore, walk up to it and either click on it or press the A button. This will cause you to pull out a pickaxe and strike the ore a couple of times. The ore will then be added to your inventory.

steps.headline: Find a Blacksmithing Station in any major town.
steps.description: You can tell that it is nearby by looking for a black anvil atop a platform. This anvil can be physically seen while you are looking around in the town. You can also hit the Start button, go to your map, and look for an icon that resembles a scale; it will say “Blacksmithing Station” when you hover over it.

steps.headline: Open the Blacksmithing menu.
steps.description: When you find a Blacksmithing Station, walk over to it and activate it with the A button, which will open the menu of blacksmithing options.

steps.headline: Select the first option, which reads “Refine.” A list of all of the ore that you have collected up until this point will appear on the screen.
Refine ores.
steps.description: Go through your ore list and find the one you want to refine by tapping the A button on it. The ore will turn into ingots of the same type. Every time you refine ore, your blacksmithing experience, which is on the bottom right side of the screen, will increase.

steps.headline: Check if you have the items needed to craft an armor or weapon.
steps.description: Open your inventory by pressing Start and selecting “Inventory.” Make sure you have the items you need to create a new piece of armor. You will typically need some ingots, a “style” gem, and a “trait” gem (if you wish to add a researched trait).

steps.headline: Locate a Blacksmithing Station.
steps.description: You will see it as a black anvil with the words “Blacksmithing station” over it when you look at it.

steps.headline: Open the Blacksmithing menu.
steps.description: Select the station with the A button, and a list of blacksmithing options will appear on the screen.

steps.headline: Go to “Creation.” Go down the list until you see “Creation.” Select it, and the Creation menu will open on the screen.
steps.description: You can select whether you want to make an armor or weapon by cycling the right and left bumpers.

steps.headline: Select the type of weapon or armor to make.
steps.description: Look at the four boxes on the screen from top to bottom. The first box is where you select the type of weapon or armor you want to make. Cycle through it with the left and right keys until you find the piece that you want to create.

steps.headline: Add an ingot.
steps.description: Select the appropriate ingot from the box below the type of weapon or armor. Scroll through using left and right until you find the type you would like to use.

steps.headline: Pick your Style material in the third box.
steps.description: Every race has its own style of weapon, so you’ll need to pick the appropriate material for the right style. For example, Khajit uses the moonstone as their style gem.

steps.headline: Select your trait gem.
steps.description: You can research traits, such as Durability, and then put those traits into weapons you want to make. Every trait has a special gem that it uses. For example, the Charged trait requires 1 Amethyst.

steps.headline: Create the weapon or armor.
steps.description: Hit the A button and your weapon or armor will be created and placed in your inventory. Once you create the weapon or armor, you will see your blacksmithing experience increase.

steps.headline: Check your inventory to make sure you have items that can be deconstructed.
steps.description: Look for any metal weapons or metal armor; these can all be broken down for extra items, and it will boost your blacksmithing experience.

steps.headline: Locate a Blacksmithing Station.
steps.description: They are available in every major city, and you will be able to find one by looking for a black anvil.

steps.headline: Activate the station.
steps.description: When you locate the anvil, walk up to it and hit the A button to activate it. A menu will open.

steps.headline: Scroll down to the third option, “Deconstruction.” Select it and the deconstruction menu will open.
Deconstruct the weapon or armor.
steps.description: Look at all the gear that you can currently deconstruct, find a piece that you want to break down, and hit the A button on it. This will cause the item to be deconstructed. You may gain items from the deconstruction, but you will always get the blacksmithing experience towards your next level up.

steps.headline: Check if you have weapons or armor to improve.
steps.description: Look at your weapons and armor in your inventory, and decide if you have something that you would like to improve. Improvements will give weapons and armor special traits, and make them better in every aspect. Besides the weapon/armor in question, you will also need special items such as homing stones, dwarven oil, grain solvent, and tempering alloy. You can get these items by deconstructing items at any Blacksmithing Station. Try to get as many of the items as you need for the improvement.

steps.headline: Find the Blacksmithing Station in the closest town you are in.
steps.description: The Blacksmithing Station is a huge black anvil. Walk up to it.

steps.headline: Activate the station.
steps.description: When you walk up to it, the Blacksmithing Station button will appear. Hit A to open the menu.

steps.headline: Access the Improvement menu.
steps.description: The fourth option down reads “Improvement.” Scroll down and hit the A button to open up the Improvement menu.

steps.headline: Select the weapon or armor to improve.
steps.description: Pick a weapon or armor from the list by moving along your items until the one you want to improve is highlighted. Select the item, and a new menu will open.

steps.headline: Add items.
steps.description: Look at the box on the left side of the screen; this box tells you how many items, like Homing Stones, you need for an improvement. One is 20% success rate, two is 40%, and so on. The best you can do is 5, at 100%.

steps.headline: Improve the weapon or armor.
steps.description: Once you’ve added the items for improvement, hit A to improve your item. You will then get a better item and blacksmithing experience. Always be careful when adding an improvement below 100 percent. If improvement fails, your improvement items as well as the weapon or armor will be destroyed.
